page.title: 10LANDSCAPE OF LAYER BRETON
page.content: Layer Breton Heath consists of 33 acres of common land. Originally this area was grassland, but over the years a great change has taken place, with the growth of heathers, gorse and deciduous trees. Over the years people have built their homes around the heath , using the land for grazing and recreation.In the earlier part of this century it was used as the village cricket ground, which gives some indi- cation of how clear the area was at the time. Today it remains common land still used for grazing geese and horses. People still find the heath ideal for walking, exercising animals and as a picnic area. The heath's well-being is primarily the concern of the Parish Council, whose duties include planting new trees, and protecting the area from abuse by people and vehicles.
